definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: Five-year-olds seem to have an unquenchable thirst for knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 五歲孩子似乎都有如飢似渴的求知慾。

sentences.english: There is no end to what the children want to know; they always like to demand the how and why.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們的求知慾是無止境的，他們凡事總要尋根究底。

sentences.english: I'm a very curious person naturally.
sentences.chinese: 我是個很有求知慾的人。

sentences.english: He is a curious boy who is always asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他是個有求知慾的孩子，老是問這問那。

sentences.english: Overcoming these stereotypes, then, has to begin with a sense of curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 要消除這些成見，首先要有一定的求知慾。

sentences.english: He wanted to know, and it was this desire that had sent him adventuring over the world.
sentences.chinese: 是求知慾送他到世界各地去冒險的。

sentences.english: He has a strong thirst for knowledge.
And more importantly, we like people who have the desire and ability to learn quickly.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，有求知慾，並且有快速學習的能力。

sentences.english: He is a curious boy who is always asking question.
sentences.chinese: 他是個有求知慾的孩子，老是問這問那。

definition: male and female/both types (acid and alkaline, positive and negative etc)/(chemistry) amphoteric
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
to extend all over the globe (idiom)/far-reaching
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
